contentrichtext.text: {{BLP sources|date=May 2010}} {{Infobox musical artist | name = Def Jef | image = | caption = | image_size = 200px | background = solo_singer | alias = | Birthname = Jeffery S. Fortson | birth_date = {{birth date and age|1966|9|27}} | origin = [[Harlem]], [[New York City]], [[New York]], US | occupation = [[rapping|Rapper]], [[Music Producer]], [[Composer]], Actor | genre = [[Rapping|Rap]], [[hip hop music|Hip Hop]] | years_active = 1989-present | label = [[Delicious Vinyl]], [[Thugline Records|Thugline]] | associated_acts = [[Young MC]]<br>[[West Coast Rap All-Stars]], [[Shaquille O'Neal]] | website = }} '''Def Jef''' is the [[stage name]] of '''Jeffrey Fortson''' (born September 27, 1966), an [[USA|American]] [[alternative music|alternative]] [[hip hop music]]ian and [[rapping|rapper]] of the late 1980s and early 1990s. He was born in [[Harlem]], New York City, New York, USA. His debut album was 1989's ''[[Just a Poet With a Soul]]'',<ref>{{cite web|url={{Allmusic|class=artist|id=p28|pure_url=yes}}|title=Biography: Def Jef|last=Kellman|first=Andy|publisher=[[All Media Guide|AMG]]|accessdate=7 May 2010}}</ref> which won critical acclaim for sociopolitical lyrics and original beats. Additionally, he was a member of the [[West Coast Rap All-Stars]], a collaboration of [[West Coast of the United States|West Coast]]-based hip hop artists who released the anti-violence single "We're All in the Same Gang" in 1990. He performed on the television variety show ''[[In Living Color]]'' in 1990.<ref name="imdb Def Jef">{{IMDb name|id=0420101|name=Def Jef}}</ref> After his second album, ''Soul Food'', was released, Def Jef moved into [[record producer|production]] full-time. Since the 1990s, he has produced, written, arranged and remixed artists including [[Nas (rapper)|Nas]], [[Snoop Dogg|Snoop Doggy Dogg]], [[Mary J. Blige]], [[Kimberley Locke]], [[Maxwell (musician)|Maxwell]], Avant, [[Tupac Shakur]], and [[Shaquille O'Neal]]. He has worked with [[Krayzie Bone]] and [[Thugline Records]]. He produced the theme songs for the Disney sitcom ''[[That's So Raven]]'' and ''[[The Game (U.S. TV series)|The Game]]''. Def Jef also appeared in the [[feature film]] ''[[Deep Cover]]'' in [[1992 in film|1992]]. ==Discography== *1989: ''[[Just a Poet with a Soul]]'' *1990: "We're All in the Same Gang" (single) (as one of the [[West Coast Rap All-Stars]]) *1991: ''[[Soul Food (Def Jef album)|Soul Food]]'' ==References== {{Reflist}} ==External links== * {{IMDb name|id=0420101|name=Def Jef}} {{Use dmy dates|date=August 2010}} {{Authority control|VIAF=56224265}} {{Persondata <!-- Metadata: see [[Wikipedia:Persondata]]. --> | NAME =Jef, Def | ALTERNATIVE NAMES = | SHORT DESCRIPTION = American rapper | DATE OF BIRTH =27 September 1966 | PLACE OF BIRTH = | DATE OF DEATH = | PLACE OF DEATH = }} {{DEFAULTSORT:Jef, Def}} [[Category:1966 births]] [[Category:Actors from New York City]] [[Category:African-American actors]] [[Category:African-American rappers]] [[Category:Delicious Vinyl artists]] [[Category:Living people]] [[Category:Rappers from New York City]] {{US-hiphop-bio-stub}}
